snippet: The Affordable Care Act makes screening tests like mammograms free. But if you have a breast lump and need a diagnosis, you have to pay.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof H Gilbert Welch maintains there is significant room for improvement in the Affordable Care Act, especially in the way it favors screening over diagnosis; holds current system could discourage a woman with a breast lump from reporting symptoms for fear of having to pay diagnostic fees; calls for elimination of fee mismatch between two types of service.
lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act makes screening tests like mammograms free. But if you have a breast lump and need a diagnosis, you have to pay.

headline.main: The Problem With Free Health Care
headline.print_headline: The Problem With Free Health Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
